features: Kills Germs: Kills germs that cause gingivitis, plaque, and bad breath and leads to healthier gums. Fights plaque build-up.
Helps Reverse Early Signs of Gum Disease: Reverses early signs of gum disease including redness, bleeding, and & inflammation
Freshens Breath: CloSYS Healthy Gums eliminates bad breath and freshens breath with gentle mint flavor
Non-Burning and Alcohol Free: Alcohol Free formula is non-burning and non-irritating. Gentle pH balanced.
Ideal for Sensitive Mouths: CloSYS mouthwash products are dye-free, sulfate free, triclosan-free, alcohol-free, and gluten-free. No harsh chemicals that will irritate or damage the mouth.
body.description: Why does most mouthwash burn and irritate? It doesn’t have to hurt to be effective. With CloSYS Mouthwashes you can protect your mouth from harmful bad breath germs and freshen your breath without the painful burn. CloSYS is one of the first mouthwashes to receive the American Dental Association seal for reducing bad breath. This gentle but powerful mouthwash is perfect for all ages because its patented formula is pH balanced and so gentle you’ll actually use it longer for better results. A 30-second rinse in the morning and evening after each brushing is easy, and all it takes to get great results. CloSYS Sensitive Mouthwash comes mildly flavored with a touch of gentle mint. Nothing overpowering or painful. Just a clean, fresh, soothing mouthwash you’ll actually use, because CloSYS is the Gentlest Oral Care Ever.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Simply put, CloSYS is the Gentlest. Oral Care. Ever. All CloSYS formulas are highly effective yet non-burning and alcohol free so they're not harsh or irritating to your mouth. And because it’s so gentle, it means you can swish it in your mouth longer without having to spit it out early and risk not getting the full benefit of the rinse. CloSYS products are also free of sulfates, triclosan, and other harsh ingredients that can burn or irritate your mouth. CloSYS Healthy Gums features: Alcohol Free Sulfate Free Triclosan Free Gentle, pH balanced Clinically Proven to fight bad breath for 24 hours

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars RECOMMENDED BY DENTAL PROFESSIONAL
reviews.reviewText: I liked that the taste wasn't overwhelming. Your mouth felt clean after use - no aftertaste. It would be a help if they described what 20ml looked like or put a cap on that would be one dose so that you could use to measure the prescribed amount. Although it's more expensive than over-the-counter mouthwashes, I think it's worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No Burning with a neutral taste
reviews.reviewText: This is my favorite mouth rinse so far. It doesn’t burn my mouth like other rinses, and I still get a clean feeling afterwards.It is good for people with sensitive gums/ teeth. The flavor is relatively neutral and has not bothered me at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So far so good
reviews.reviewText: I got this mouthwash bc a bump was appearing on my gums so that was telling me that I need to take more care of my gums. It's hard to floss with braces but since using this mouthwash the bump has been going down, it hasn't been that long but I like it so far

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars First time using is a surprise
reviews.reviewText: I love this mouth wash. It really is tasteless. It is alcohol free so it doesn’t burn. I use it to pre-rinse my mouth before brushing. Kind of a boost for the brushing. I use very little toothpaste. Then I rinse with the harsh but great mouthwash, followed by act fluoride rinse. I know…but I am careful not to accidentally swallow any. The difference in my mouth health since I started this is so exciting! My breath is even fresh when I wake up. I do this morning and before bed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars 11 hours Later, I still can't taste anything - Edit: BrainFreeze Technique Protects TasteBuds
reviews.reviewText: I got this mouthwash because a clinical trail said it was good for gum health and prevented and reversed gum damaging effects. . I measured out the amount they suggest to use but it was a lot so I use about half of that amount. I swished it and spit it out but I didn't rinse after because it was recomended not to so the mouthrinse would coat my teeth, gums, and protect it or whatever.I used it before bed, figured a smart time to use it, it was around 11pm ish. It is Now 11:30 am the next day and i've tried eating a piece of cheese and eating a hotdog and Most of my sense of taste is gone. I can tell it is salty but I can't tell that it was cheese, I couldn't taste the meat. The Top surface of my tongue feels sorta numb.I went online to look up about this effect and found that on wikipedia "Temporary loss of taste:In a small percentage of population, CPC can alter or eliminate the sense of taste. The effect generally goes away a few days after discontinuing use of the product."WTF?! Seems likt that sould be included in the warnings on the Product Label!I don't know how well the product works for deep cleaning or gum health because I've only used it 3 times but This is going to be a problem if I cannot taste my food.The Product works well to reduce plague and tartar because you won't want to eat any food!!! /Sarcasm8/3/2023I have started a return and have yet to take it to UPS and I'm tryig to find a way to use this. Y'know how you press your tongue against the roof of your mouth to stop Brain-Freeze? Well, I tried doing that while rinsing with this product. I basically poured it into my mouth underneath my tongue and sorta jiggled it back and forth with my cheeks before spitting it out, preventing any of it from coating the top of my tongue. I followed the rest of the dental routine with regular toothpaste, and then the Listerine alcohol wash and then the Act No Alcohol wash, all while keeping my tongue against the roof. This morning I was able to enjoy some seasoned eggs and I was able to taste them just fine. For me this is proof that I should NOT allow CloSys to come into contact with my tastebuds.Since I've heard good things about it, other than this, I may keep it and do this oddball tongue gymnastics while using it. Perhaps it can still give me a jumpstart on better dental health, but it is a certainty that I will NOT be purchasing it again once I run out, Unless my gums completery revert back to childhood quality! LOL
